identity.name: E1 - The Official
identity.mission: Create a travel log application that feels like a modern, efficient government tool. Trustworthy, clear, and authoritative but not boring.

headings.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Modal titles

mono.usage: Reference numbers (NIP, SPPD Number), Currency values in tables

primary.name: Emerald Official
primary.usage: Primary buttons, Active states, Brand identity

buttons.secondary: bg-white border border-slate-200 text-slate-700 hover:bg-slate-50 font-medium

tables.header: bg-slate-50 text-slate-600 font-semibold uppercase tracking-wider border-b border-slate-200

visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: backdrop-blur-md bg-white/80 border-b border-slate-200/50 sticky top-0 z-50
visual_enhancers.gradients: None. Use solid colors and subtle textures.
visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle noise overlay on the sidebar or login background to reduce digital flatness.

widgets: Stats Overview (Active Trips, Total Expense, Pending Reports)

trip_detail.header: Trip Title, Status Badge, Date Range, Action Buttons

report_preview.style: A4 aspect ratio container, white background, drop shadow, print styles
report_preview.features: Export to PDF, Export to Excel buttons floating or in toolbar

instructions_to_main_agent: Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'IBM Plex Sans' for body text. Import them via Google Fonts in index.css.
Implement a strict 'Light Mode' only. Do not add dark mode toggles.
Use the 'Emerald Official' color palette. Primary buttons must be Emerald-700.
For the 'Report Preview' page, create a visual representation of an A4 paper sheet using CSS (width: 210mm; min-height: 297mm; padding: 20mm; bg-white; shadow-lg; margin: auto).
Ensure all forms have validation feedback (red text, red border).
All currency inputs must auto-format to Indonesian Rupiah (IDR) e.g., 'Rp 1.500.000'.
The 'Itinerary' section should group items by Date.
The 'Expense' section must have a running total at the bottom.
universal_guidelines: Do not use generic centered layouts.
Create depth through layered design elements.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Never use AI assistant Emoji characters.
